intro: Polycarpaea corymbosa var. effusa, commonly known as the spreading polycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in open woodlands and grasslands. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a distinct aroma. Its showy, yellow flowers are arranged in corymbs, which are flat-topped or伞形 clusters. The species is noted for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in semi-arid conditions.
